A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The Movie:
Unlike the lackluster 7th Episode\, Star Wars: The Last Jedi is a step in the right direction. Although there are a few rough moments\, referencing the scene with Leia and her sudden dues-ex-machina force abilities as her death grows imminent\, it's good moments far out way the bad. TLJ is a Star Wars film\, not a Abrams film.

The Audience:
I believe this is what has caused the polarization in both viewing an take away. Many assumed that TLJ would be a continuation of the re-visualization of Star Wars\, that in my opinion\, had begun to slowly destroy the franchise. However\, TLJ brings back what was good in the old\, with a stand alone story line that wraps up Luke's journey nicely\, and is leading the trilogy in a more memorable and independent direction. The franchise is looking up since the worrying release of The Force Awakens.
